name.japanese: いっぽんマツの武器店

description: A weapon shop in Loguetown owned by Ipponmatsu, known for carrying high-quality swords and weapons. The shop is where Zoro acquires the legendary Sandai Kitetsu and Yubashiri.
significance: The location where one of the most iconic moments in Zoro's character arc occurs - testing the cursed sword. This shop plays a crucial role in Zoro's development as a swordsman.

keyEvents.title: Zoro Arrives at Weapon Shop
keyEvents.description: Zoro enters the shop seeking new swords to replace those destroyed by Mihawk.

keyEvents.title: Sandai Kitetsu Discovered
keyEvents.description: Zoro discovers the cursed Sandai Kitetsu among the shop's inventory.

keyEvents.title: Cursed Sword Test
keyEvents.description: Zoro tests his luck against the cursed Sandai Kitetsu inside the shop.

keyEvents.title: Zoro Receives Two Legendary Swords
keyEvents.description: Ipponmatsu gifts Zoro both Sandai Kitetsu and Yubashiri.

description: Known as the 'Town of the Beginning and the End,' Loguetown is where Gol D. Roger was born and executed. It is the last town before the entrance to the Grand Line and a popular stop for pirates.
significance: Historic town that serves as a transition point between the East Blue Saga and the Grand Line. The location of Gol D. Roger's execution platform creates symbolic parallels between Roger and Luffy.

keyEvents.title: Zoro Overpowers Marines
keyEvents.description: Zoro overpowers two Marines and takes their money in the streets of Loguetown.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Encounters Disguised Buggy Pirates
keyEvents.description: Luffy lands in Loguetown after being launched from the execution platform and encounters disguised Buggy Pirates.

name.japanese: ローグタウン海軍基地

description: The Marine base in Loguetown commanded by Captain Smoker. It serves as a strategic point to monitor pirates entering the Grand Line.
significance: Important Marine stronghold that introduces Smoker as a formidable Marine antagonist.

keyEvents.title: Zoro Works as Janitor
keyEvents.description: Tashigi forces Zoro to work as a janitor at the Marine base to pay for broken glasses.

description: The historic execution platform in Loguetown where Gol D. Roger, the Pirate King, was executed. It has become a famous landmark and symbol of the beginning of the Great Pirate Era.
significance: Symbolically connects Luffy to Gol D. Roger and represents the transition from the East Blue to the Grand Line. The platform is central to multiple key moments in the Loguetown arc.

keyEvents.title: Smoker Confronts Luffy
keyEvents.description: Smoker confronts Luffy at the execution platform in an anime-original scene.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Accidentally Launches Away
keyEvents.description: Luffy misfires an attack and launches himself away from the platform.
